amphipolis.model

Class Zone

  • java.lang.Object
    • amphipolis.model.Zone
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EntranceZone

    public class Zone
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a generic area on the board where tiles can be placed and drawn. Functions as a dynamic collection (First-In-Last-Out or generic collection) of tiles. Invariant: The internal list of tiles is never null. Invariant: The zone stores generic Tile objects, allowing for polymorphism (holding Mosaics, Amphoras, etc.).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Tile> tiles
      The list of tiles currently in this zone.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Zone

        public Zone()
        Constructor. Initializes the empty list of tiles.

    • Method Detail

      • addTile

        public void addTile(Tile t)
        Adds a tile to the zone. * Pre-condition: The tile t must not be null. Post-condition: The tile is added to the end of the list. The size increases by 1. * @param t The tile object to add.

      • removeTile

        public Tile removeTile()
        Removes the top/last tile from the zone (simulating a stack or queue). * Pre-condition: The zone must not be empty. Post-condition: The tile is removed from the list. The size decreases by 1. * @return The tile that was removed.

      • getTiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getTiles()
        Returns a reference to the list of tiles. * Pre-condition: The list is not empty (according to your spec). Post-condition: Returns the direct reference (pointer) to the internal list. * @return The ArrayList of tiles.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the zone is empty.
        Returns:
        true if size is 0, false otherwise.
